pullrequest.title: Improve timeout error reporting in ServerFixture

content.html:
I think better reporting of failures is good.

As an aside, I think that many of these timeout failures are caused by ServerFixture::HasEntity giving false negatives (ie. entities do exist but HasEntity says they do not). I've been testing the following fix (applied to backport_fixes_1.9 branch):

diff -r 4af863cd149d test/ServerFixture.hh
--- a/test/ServerFixture.hh Thu Sep 12 02:29:37 2013 +0200
+++ b/test/ServerFixture.hh Thu Sep 12 10:22:04 2013 -0700
@@ -289,10 +289,18 @@

   protected: bool HasEntity(const std::string &_name)
              {
-               boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(this->receiveMutex);
-               std::map<std::string, math::Pose>::iterator iter;
-               iter = this->poses.find(_name);
-               return iter != this->poses.end();
+               physics::WorldPtr world = physics::get_world();
+               if (world)
+               {
+                 return (world->GetEntity(_name) != NULL);
+               }
+               else
+               {
+                 boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(this->receiveMutex);
+                 std::map<std::string, math::Pose>::iterator iter;
+                 iter = this->poses.find(_name);
+                 return iter != this->poses.end();
+               }
              }

   protected: void PrintImage(const std::string &_name, unsigned char **_image,

but I haven't fully tested it yet. I'm just mentioning this because it seems relevant to this pull request.

pullrequest.title: Improve timeout error reporting in ServerFixture

content.raw: My `HasEntity` patch is looking good to me after some brief testing. I'll run it overnight tonight. It can go in a separate pull request. It's currently in branch improve_serverfixture_msgs_scpeters (ccd3f61).
